data.title: Shopping Time
data.statement: Given a <<max amount of money to spend>>, and a list of groceries, output whether or not you will be able to purchase everything on your list. Assume you only need one of any item. There will be no duplicates.

4

data.constraints:
Max amount of money > 0
Shopping List has at least 1 item
N > 0
All prices in whole dollars
data.stubGenerator:
read max:int
read sList:string(255)
read N:int
loop N read str:string(255)
write true/false
data.inputDescription:
Line 1: A number representing the <<max amount of money you have>>
Line 2: A comma delimited string of your shopping list
Line 3: Number of items available for purchase
Next 'N' Lines: An Item and its price separated by a comma
data.outputDescription:
A string true/false for whether you can purchase or not.
If you Can Purchase (true), output the money remaining afterwards.
If you Cannot Purchase (false), output how much <<more>> money you would need to be able to purchase everything on the list.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a max amount of money to spend, and a list of groceries, output whether or not you will be able to purchase everything on your list. Assume you only need one of any item. There will be no duplicates.
Input
Line 1: A number representing the max amount of money you have
Line 2: A comma delimited string of your shopping list
Line 3: Number of items available for purchase
Next 'N' Lines: An Item and its price separated by a comma
Output
A string true/false for whether you can purchase or not.
If you Can Purchase (true), output the money remaining afterwards.
If you Cannot Purchase (false), output how much more money you would need to be able to purchase everything on the list.
Constraints
Max amount of money > 0
Shopping List has at least 1 item
N > 0
All prices in whole dollars
Example
Input
2
Lemonade
1
Lemonade,2
Output
true
0
